conformance.naming

Class DeletionTest.DeletionStorageServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • conformance.naming.TestStorageServer
      • conformance.naming.DeletionTest.DeletionStorageServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command, Storage
    Enclosing class:
    DeletionTest

    private class DeletionTest.DeletionStorageServer
extends TestStorageServer
    Class of storage servers used in the test.

    This type of storage server expects to be commanded to delete a file or a directory. When the command is received, it checks that the argument is valid, and that it is not a duplicate command for this storage server.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean hosts_directory
      Indicates that the storage server still hosts a copy of the directory.

      Indicates that the storage server still hosts a copy of the file.

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        public boolean delete(Path path)
        Accepts a delete request from the naming server.

        This method checks that the path supplied with the request is valid, refers to either the file or the directory hosted on the server, and that the object has not yet been deleted. If all these conditions are met, the number of deletions is incremented. Otherwise, the test fails.

        Specified by:
        delete in interface Command
        Overrides:
        delete in class TestStorageServer
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the object to be deleted.
        Returns:
        true if and only if a valid object is deleted.

      • copy

        public boolean copy(Path file,
                    Storage server)
        Accepts replication requests and simulates their success.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface Command
        Overrides:
        copy in class TestStorageServer
        Parameters:
        file - Path to the file to be copied.
        server - Storage server from which the file is to be downloaded.
        Returns:
        true if the file is successfully copied; false otherwise.
